title: The Cold War
key_facts: A period of geopolitical tension between the United States and the Soviet Union and their respective allies.
No large-scale direct fighting between the two superpowers, but multiple proxy wars (Korea, Vietnam, Afghanistan).
Marked by the nuclear arms race, the Space Race, and the ideological struggle between capitalism and communism.
Ended with the dissolution of the Soviet Union in 1991.
causes: Ideological conflict between Soviet Communism and Western Capitalism.
Power vacuum in Europe after World War II.
Fear of nuclear annihilation (Mutually Assured Destruction).
outcome: Dissolution of the Soviet Union in December 1991.
Victory for the Western Bloc and the United States.

figures.name: Harry S. Truman
figures.role: US President; established the Truman Doctrine to contain communism.

figures.name: Joseph Stalin
figures.role: Leader of the Soviet Union; established the Eastern Bloc.

figures.name: John F. Kennedy
figures.role: US President during the Cuban Missile Crisis.

figures.name: Mikhail Gorbachev
figures.role: Soviet leader whose reforms (Glasnost/Perestroika) led to the end of the Cold War.

impacts: Collapse of the Soviet Union and end of the bipolar world order.
Establishment of NATO and the European Union.
Shaped modern conflicts in the Middle East and Asia.
